1.text: Spritz the silk down with water so it’s damp.

2.text: Turn the clothing item inside-out to protect the silk.

3.text: Smooth out the silk so it’s flat on your ironing board.

4.text: Arrange a press cloth on top of the silk.

5.text: Adjust your iron to the lowest heat setting.

6.text: Center the iron on the press cloth and press it down for a few seconds.

7.text: Lift the iron straight up and give the silk a few seconds to cool off.

8.text: Repeat this pressing and lifting pattern along your silk.

9.text: Wear, display, or hang up your silk once you’re done ironing it.
